relation: Apparel structure and process for making apparel
pageTitle: Patent US5109546 - Exercise suit with resilient reinforcing - Google Patents
textBeforeTable: Patent Citations While the invention has been described in complete detail and pictorially shown in the accompanying drawings, it is not to be limited to such details since many changes and modifications may be made in the invention without departing from the spirit and the scope thereof. Hence, it is described to cover any and all modifications and forms which may come within the language and scope of the appended claims. In use, the wearer pulls the pants 20 and top 44 on much like conventional exercise suits. The waist drawstring 28 is tied and the adjustment is made on the sides over the hips detaching and reattaching the hook and loop tape 40 creating the desired resistance to the reinforcing segment 38 and leg bands 42. The knee pads 32 are likewise adjusted and the person conducts the desired exercise readjusting when desired. The top 44 is made of the same material as the pants 20 and the leg and side bands 42 and 58 are made of latex rubber strips having a width from 4 inches (10.2 cm) to 6 inches (15.2 cm) wide. While any latex rubber strips may be used, it has been found that the material known by its tradename THERA-BAND has proven optimum in the application. The reinforcing segment and collar 38 and 54 preferably are made of heavy 75 percent elastic or so called SUPER-SPANDEX. A pair of elongatable resistive side
